name: Acolyte
description: You have spent your life in service to a temple or sacred order, dedicating yourself to rites, rituals, and acts of faith. Your days were filled with prayer, ceremony, and sacred tradition—whether before a grand altar, among remote ruins, or in a humble shrine tucked away from society. Not all acolytes are priests. You may have served as a temple attendant, ceremonial assistant, scholar of the divine, or even a high-ranking hierophant before a calling led you down a different path.

feature.name: Shelter of the Faithful
feature.description: You can perform religious ceremonies of your deity and receive free healing and care at temples or shrines of your faith (material components not included). You have a place to stay at a temple associated with your god, and can request modest non-hazardous aid from clergy.

name: Arcane Student
description: You spent your formative years under the tutelage of mages or magical researchers. Whether or not you completed your training, you were exposed to the secrets and disciplines of arcane study. You may not be a full-fledged wizard, but you know the jargon, respect the craft, and have likely seen magic change lives—for better or worse.

feature.name: Arcane Correspondent
feature.description: You are part of a network of magical scholars, allowing you to send and receive messages, scrolls, and minor favors through arcane contacts at colleges, towers, or guilds in most large cities.

name: Criminal
description: You lived your life in the shadows—lifting coin purses, casing mansions, or moving contraband across borders. Maybe you were part of a thieves' guild or simply acted alone with a sharp mind and quicker fingers. Some criminals fight injustice through illegal means; others care only for profit or survival. Whether you broke locks or broke bones, the underworld taught you lessons the law never could.

feature.name: Underworld Awareness
feature.description: You're familiar with the signs, safehouses, and slang of the criminal world. In any settlement, you can locate hidden entrances, avoid watch patrols, and identify the safest alley or escape route. You also recognize criminal markings (such as chalk glyphs or tattoos) and can interpret their meaning or affiliation.

name: Disgraced Noble
description: You were born into privilege, but titles crumble and wealth fades. Betrayal, scandal, or ambition brought your downfall—and now you walk among those who once served you, chasing a different kind of legacy.

feature.name: Fallen Name
feature.description: Your name still carries weight, though it opens as many doors as it closes. In places where your house was once respected, you may call upon favors, hospitality, or access to noble circles—though suspicion or gossip often follows.

name: Fence
description: You specialized in making hot items disappear and questionable wares reappear. You may have worked for a thieves' guild, a corrupt noble, or yourself—but either way, you know the value of silence.

feature.name: Underworld Connections
feature.description: You know how to quietly move stolen or illicit goods. In any sizable settlement, you can usually find a buyer (or a broker) for unusual items—though the price may include secrets or favors.

name: Guild Scribe
description: You worked behind the scenes for a trade guild, noble house, or mercantile company. You processed contracts, tallied ledgers, and perhaps buried a few inconvenient documents. You know how power moves in ink, not steel.

feature.name: Bureaucratic Acumen
feature.description: You know how to navigate official systems. You can acquire mundane permits, gain access to archives, or decipher bureaucratic codes and records. Clerks and scribes recognize your training and often underestimate your ambitions.

name: Miner
description: You labored in the dark beneath the earth, swinging picks and breaking stone. Whether you dug for iron, gems, or something stranger, the deep places taught you patience, fear, and the feel of danger in the stone.

feature.name: Deep Instincts
feature.description: You have an intuitive sense for underground spaces. You can always tell if you're underground, the depth below surface, and the direction to the nearest slope or shaft. You can also identify dangerous rock formations or signs of instability.

name: Runesmith's Apprentice
description: You worked at the forge—or at the bench—carving symbols of power into metal and stone. You saw firsthand the blend of craft and sorcery, and your fingers remember the weight of enchanted steel.
equipment: Fragment of a broken rune stone

feature.name: Sigil Sense
feature.description: You can identify active magical runes and wards on sight. With a few minutes of study, you can discern the purpose of magical inscriptions or detect the presence of dormant glyphs (at GM's discretion).

name: Sage
description: You spent your life in dusty halls, cluttered libraries, or wandering ruins in search of forgotten truths. Whether as a university scholar, royal scribe, or solitary academic, your mind was your sharpest weapon, and knowledge your most faithful companion. Sages often walk the line between obsession and genius. You may have uncovered secrets no one was meant to know—or challenged truths long considered absolute.

feature.name: Researcher's Recall
feature.description: If you spend 10 minutes consulting written knowledge, you can recall or discover a useful fact related to your query. When you fail an Arcana, History, or Religion check, the GM may grant a clue or summary based on prior research or study.

name: Soldier
description: You lived by orders, discipline, and steel—on blood-soaked fields, in city garrisons, or aboard the decks of warships. Whether you served in a noble army, rebel force, or mercenary company, the chain of command shaped you. Some soldiers left honor behind for gold. Others still serve a cause or commander, even as they seek new battles.

feature.name: Military Bearing
feature.description: You recognize and recall military ranks, banners, tactics, and formations. When dealing with soldiers, mercenaries, or veterans of any nation, you can secure minor assistance, such as maps, rations, camp shelter, or tactical advice.

name: Street Performer
description: You sang for your supper, danced in the square, or juggled knives to make passersby gasp. You lived on charm, timing, and guts—often only one step ahead of the guard or your own hunger.

feature.name: Crowd Reader
feature.description: You can quickly gauge the mood of a crowd and know how to win them over—or disappear into them. You can earn a few coins with a short performance or use the crowd to cover an escape or a sleight of hand attempt.

name: Temple Orphan
description: You were raised by monks, nuns, or ascetics after being abandoned, orphaned, or left at a temple's doorstep. Your early life was steeped in ritual, tradition, and contemplation. Whether you embraced or rejected that upbringing, it shaped your view of the world.

feature.name: Sanctuary
feature.description: Once per long rest, you may seek brief shelter or assistance at a temple, shrine, or monastery aligned with your former faith. This may include a place to rest, medical attention, or temporary protection from enemies.

name: Town Guard
description: You kept the peace—whether patrolling the streets, enforcing curfews, or breaking up bar brawls. Though you've left your post behind, you still carry the discipline, instincts, and scars of service. Maybe you're seeking justice... or escaping it.

feature.name: Lawman's Authority
feature.description: You can identify yourself as a former officer of the law. In settlements where your reputation holds sway, civilians are more inclined to cooperate, and local guards may offer basic assistance or grant access to secure areas (at the GM's discretion).

name: Wanderer
description: You've walked countless roads—through forest, mountain, desert, and ruin. Home is wherever you stop for the night, and every new horizon calls you onward. You've heard stories in ten dialects and seen the stars from every angle.

feature.name: Wayfarer's Memory
feature.description: You can always recall the layout of terrain, the location of natural features, and safe paths you've traveled before. You can also find fresh water, edible plants, and temporary shelter with minimal effort in the wild.
